TopicTitle: SSTO Buggy Lifter + 1 and 3 Man Buggy's

Articles.Content:
Hi Guys, thought i'd post a couple of my buggy's and the SSTO Lifter i use to get them off kerbin and safely delivered to the moon/minmus.

first up the lifter capable of shifting about 10 Tons of worthless crap expensive cutting edge hardware into orbit and beyond...

Shown here with a 1 man buggy ready to deploy.

Action Group Toggles

1. Turbojets

2. Toroidals

3. Air Intakes

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Next up the 1 and 3 man buggys...

Javascript is disabled. View full album

No action groups have been setup for either buggys, currently only the 1 man buggy has a self-righting system should it end up on its roof simply activate the landing struts with the "g" key.

buggys are still under development and will be updated in the future.

Craft Files

Lifter Only

Lifter + 1 Man Buggy

1 Man Buggy

3 Man Buggy

All craft files contain 100% less mechjeb than shown in any screenshots

As always comments and suggestions appreciated

-KC-
You are really on a roll lately. Only 13 posts and you are already putting out some of the most impressive SSTO designs that I've seen.

You are really on a roll lately. Only 13 posts and you are already putting out some of the most impressive SSTO designs that I've seen.

Thanks mate, high praise from someone with the skill to make that munstrosity

I've been playing and lurking on the forums for nearly a year before .21 came out. So i started from scratch and thought i'd finally register join in with you all and share some of my new designs
Finally a decent SSTO that can even carry a payload! Thank you for sharing this great piece of cr... ahem, cutting edge hardware ;-D

Finally a decent SSTO that can even carry a payload! Thank you for sharing this great piece of cr... ahem, cutting edge hardware ;-D

That line made me chuckle, what a Kerbal way of saying it
